remarks: Given a function with bounded derivative, on an open interval, here is an absolute bound to the difference of the image of two points in the interval.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
dvbdfbdioolem1.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.f $e |- ( ph -> F : ( A (,) B ) --> RR ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.dmdv $e |- ( ph -> dom ( RR _D F ) = ( A (,) B ) ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. RR ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.dvbd $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. ( A (,) B ) ( abs ` ( ( RR _D F ) ` x ) ) <_ K ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( A (,) B ) ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( C (,) B ) ) $.
dvbdfbdioolem1 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( abs ` ( ( F ` D ) - ( F ` C ) ) ) <_ ( K x. ( D - C ) ) /\ ( abs ` ( ( F ` D ) - ( F ` C ) ) ) <_ ( K x. ( B - A ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
$d F x $.
$d K x $.
$d ph x $.
